<noinclude>{{italic title|Java Edition}}
{{Exclusive|Java}}</noinclude>
[[File:Banner beta.png|x100px]]

''[[Minecraft: Java Edition]]'' is one of the two [[edition]]s of ''[[Minecraft]]'' known for being written in {{w|Java}} and depends on the ''[[Minecraft Launcher]]'' to download, update, and play. Most of the new development projects focus on either creating entirely new programs from scratch that interoperate with ''Minecraft'' (such as a bot or server) or [[mod]]ding projects that integrate with the game's [[client.jar|client]] or [[server.jar|server]] and provide bug fixes, new features, and several enhancements to existing features.

== Documentation ==
There are ongoing efforts to keep reverse engineered documentation updated, but it isn't as easy as it sounds. The protocol generally changes slightly with each release. Below are links to the current documentation segments, which '''may or may not be completely up to date'''.

=== <span class="anchor" id="Mojang APIs"></span>''Minecraft'' APIs ===
* Authentication systems &ndash; ''Minecraft'' have used multiple authentication systems in the past:
** [[Microsoft authentication]] &ndash; the current authentication system based on Microsoft account and Xbox Live.
** [[Yggdrasil]] &ndash; the second authentication system based on legacy Mojang account.
** [[Legacy Minecraft authentication]] &ndash; the first authentication system based on legacy ''Minecraft'' account.
* [[Mojang API]] &ndash; several legacy and current APIs for querying player data and make changes programmatically.
* {{tpl|Minecraft Wiki:Projects/wiki.vg merge/Game files|Game files|vg}}
* {{tpl|Minecraft Wiki:Projects/wiki.vg merge/Realms API|Realms API|vg}}
* {{tpl|Minecraft Wiki:Projects/wiki.vg merge/Snoop|Snoop|vg}}

=== Miscellaneous ===
* Data formats &ndash; several data formats used by ''Minecraft'' to store data readable by machines or humans:
** {{tpl|Minecraft Wiki:Projects/wiki.vg merge/NBT|NBT|vg}}/{{tpl|NBT format||main}} &ndash; a {{w|tree data structure}} and binary data format used by ''Minecraft'' in many save files to store arbitrary data.
** [[JSON]] &ndash; a human-readable data interchange formats used by the game in many data-driven definitions of an object in [[resource pack]] and [[data pack]].
* Text formatting and styling &ndash; several resources on ''Minecraft'''s rendering of text:
** [[Font]] &ndash; changes how characters look in the game defined by [[resource pack]].
** [[Text component]] &ndash; the modern way to define text formatting, such as italic, bold, strike through, colors, and other types of formatting in ''Minecraft''.
** [[Formatting codes]] &ndash; the legacy way to define text formatting based on "§" character.
* [[Server]] protocols and APIs:
** [[RCON]]
** [[Query]]
** [[Minecraft Server Management Protocol]]

== <span class="anchor" id="Tools & Mods"></span>Tools and mods ==
* [[Tutorial:Programs and editors/Client reimplementations|Clients]] - third-party ''Java Edition'' clients
* {{tpl|Minecraft Wiki:Projects/wiki.vg merge/Server List|Servers|vg}} - third-party ''Java Edition'' servers
* {{tpl|Minecraft Wiki:Projects/wiki.vg merge/Library List|Libraries|vg}} - libraries to interface with Minecraft data files or network protocols
* {{tpl|Minecraft Wiki:Projects/wiki.vg merge/Utility List|Utilities|vg}} - tools that interface with a client, server, or data files, such as proxies, bots, or inventory editors
* {{tpl|Minecraft Wiki:Projects/wiki.vg merge/Wrapper List|Wrappers|vg}} - mods that override features in the client or server
* {{tpl|Minecraft Wiki:Projects/wiki.vg merge/Generator List|Generators|vg}} - tools that extract data from Mojang to a readable format
* {{tpl|Minecraft Wiki:Projects/wiki.vg merge/Decompiler List|Decompilers|vg}} - tools for decompiling ''Java Edition''
* [https://github.com/mcdevs/Burger/ Burger] - a tool that generates information for arbitrary ''Java Edition'' versions
** [[User:Pokechu22|Pokechu22]]'s [https://github.com/Pokechu22/Burger fork] - where new version development is mostly done
** [https://pokechu22.github.io/BurgerWebViewer/ Burger Vitrine] - shows differences in data and protocol between arbitrary versions
** [https://github.com/Matsv/PAaaS PAaaS] - shows differences in protocol and sounds for newer versions (1.8 and above)
